translations.text: Digital map of Arthur Schnitzler's stays in Vienna (1862-1931). Over 47,000 georeferenced stays at nearly 4,950 locations based on his diary and correspondence. A Digital Humanities project for the geographical mapping of his paths through the city.
Arthur Schnitzler, Vienna, map, Digital Humanities, geolocation, literature, diary, georeferencing, Viennese Modernism, mapping
A geographical mapping by Martin Anton Müller and Laura Untner
Historical black and white view of Vienna, circa 1900, showing the city center and Danube Canal
Stylized silhouette of Arthur Schnitzler with hat and glasses against historic Vienna backdrop

Arthur Schnitzler was born in 1862 in Vienna on Praterstraße and died in 1931 on Sternwartestraße, barely ten kilometers away. He wrote successful plays, novels, and stories, most of which are set in Vienna. He only left the city for travels and summer stays. Thanks to his

and other documents, we currently record over 47,000 stays at nearly 4,950 locations. Currently, there is no other person of his time with as much freely available and georeferenced data. This shows where Schnitzler moved, which houses, streets, districts, cities, and countries he knew, and which were important to him. At the same time, you can see where he never stayed.
To the map of days of stay
Interactive map with colored dots showing the frequency of Schnitzler's stays at various locations
At which locations did Schnitzler stay most frequently? A map by
Map with filter options for location types such as museum, theater, café, residence, or park
Which museums did Schnitzler visit? A quick answer can be found in the
Tabular listing of all locations with names, coordinates, days of stay, and known residents

List of place names from diary and letters that have not yet been assigned to a geographical position

Interactive feature to calculate at which location Schnitzler was closest to you in time

Logo of the Cultural Department of the City of Vienna
Map of Days of Stay | Wiener Schnitzler
Interactive map of all days Arthur Schnitzler stayed at locations, sorted by frequency. Visualization of over 47,000 georeferenced stays at nearly 4,950 locations.
The color of the dot indicates the total number of documented days of stay at this location.
The selection field with location names is not a filter, but focuses on the respective location.
This page visualizes all days on which Schnitzler stayed at a particular location. Selecting a dot displays more detailed information and links.
Stays by Individual Days | Wiener Schnitzler
Browse Schnitzler's locations day by day. Detailed map representation for each individual day between 1862 and 1931.
toggle on/off. It makes the geographical space more visible. It does not represent the order in which the locations were visited.
This page visualizes individual days in Schnitzler's life.
Searchable directory of all nearly 4,950 locations where Arthur Schnitzler stayed, with residents, coordinates, and frequencies.
This English version was automatically translated with AI assistance.
Schnitzler's stays by types of places – Overview by location types such as residential buildings, theaters, cafés and other categories
Schnitzler's Stays by Types of Places
The selection field with location names is not a filter, but focuses on the respective location.

This page visualizes the locations by types of places. Some places cannot be distinguished cleanly from each other (e.g., "Café-Restaurant"). When in doubt, it is advisable to select similar types generously.
Where were you closest to Schnitzler? – Find out which places in Vienna Arthur Schnitzler visited near you
Where were you closest to Schnitzler?
Please select share location or enter coordinates. (No, we're not interested in where you hang out.)
Share on Bluesky - opens in new window
Unidentified locations of Arthur Schnitzler – Place names from diary and letters that could not yet be assigned to a precise geographic position.
We have so far only been able to locate the following places imprecisely on the map. We welcome any hints that can contribute to solving this.
